title: Using GraphQL, STAFF with NO explicit permissions on Store can retrieve Shopify Payments Balance.

profile.name: Shopify
profile.about: Shopify is a multi-channel commerce platform that helps people sell online, in-store, and everywhere in between.

activities.message:
Hi,

Any updates on this?

Cheers,
@h13-
Thank you for your report! We have been able to reproduce the issue and our engineering team is investigating.
Thank you for this report @h13-, we're awarding an initial 500$ and we will determine the final amount once the issue is resolved.

Hi,

Just checking if there is any movement on this bug? Was curious since this has been triaged for nearly 2 months now. 

Thanks,
@h13- -

Hi @h13-,
Sorry there's no update. When we have one, we will let you know.

Hi @h13-,
We shipped a fix for this so I'm resolving it now. Users without the settings permission will always see an empty array. Please let us know if you're able to bypass the fix. We will follow up with you before the end of the week regarding the final bounty amount.
Looks fixed Pete. Thanks for the update.

We've decided that the $500 bounty already awarded (which is equal to the minimum for the "Circumvention of user permission model" category) is appropriate for this issue.

We look forward to hearing from you again soon!

Thanks for the update @clayton. But would you please care to explain why this was lowered to a LOW issue?

I actually thought this would have been worth a little more since you right mentioned that this falls into the category of "Circumvention of user permission model". The STAFF member over here was not assigned literally no permissions at all and yet he was able to view `Shopify Payments` balance of store. Had a STAFF had some sort of permission(s) other than `Settings` permission and was able to to view the balances would make the report fall into the bucket of this being rewarded with a minimum bounty but since the STAFF had no permissions what so ever and still was able to fetch payment balances IMO bumps up the severity to a MEDIUM at least.

At the end, I respect Shopify's decision but just wanted to voice out my opinion regarding the severity. Thanks anyways and wish you all a Merry Christmas & Happy New Year!!

Cheers,
@h13-

> The STAFF member over here was not assigned literally no permissions at all

The permissions control access to certain parts of the admin panel; other parts of it are intentionally accessible to all staff members. Even if all the permissions boxes are unchecked, the staff member still has permission to access some things.

In this case, it was not intended for Shopify payments details to be available to all staff members. Our bounty payout and severity rating were based on the nature of the information that was unintentionally exposed. We believe it was only sufficient to justify the minimum bounty payout for this category.

All the best,
@clayton
